causes: German colonial expansion and land seizures in Southwest Africa
Exploitation of Herero and Nama labor under German rule
Tensions over cattle confiscation and loss of indigenous land
Resentment against harsh treatment by German settlers and military
events_leading_up_to_war: Increasing German settlement displacing Herero and Nama populations
Forced labor policies and economic restrictions on indigenous people
Herero rebellion against German rule in January 1904
Nama uprising following Herero defeat in late 1904

result.general: Decisive German military victory, but with international condemnation for genocide
result.treaty: No formal treaty; Namibia remained under German control until World War I
result.territorial_changes: German Southwest Africa remained a colony until taken by South Africa in 1915

German.warships: Several naval vessels used for troop transport

Herero_and_Nama.troops: Approximately 10,000 Herero fighters, smaller Nama forces
Herero_and_Nama.warriors: Mostly armed with spears, some with firearms

Herero_and_Nama.survivors: Many survivors placed in concentration camps

major_battles.name: Battle of Waterberg
major_battles.description: German forces decisively defeated the Herero, forcing them into the Omaheke Desert where many perished.

major_battles.name: Guerrilla War Against the Nama
major_battles.description: Nama fighters engaged in prolonged guerrilla resistance against German forces.

terms: Extermination orders issued by General von Trotha against the Herero
Herero forced into the Omaheke Desert to die of starvation and thirst
Survivors placed in concentration camps and subjected to forced labor
impact: Mass killings recognized as one of the first genocides of the 20th century
Harsh colonial policies continued in German Southwest Africa

long_term_effects: German Southwest Africa remained a colony until World War I
Genocide set a precedent for later racial policies by Germany
Namibia continues to seek reparations from Germany
Acknowledgment of genocide by the German government in 2021

economic: Confiscation of Herero and Nama lands by German settlers
Forced labor systems enriched German colonial enterprises
political: Established brutal precedent for European colonial rule in Africa
Germany's defeat in World War I led to loss of the colony
social: Severe depopulation of Herero and Nama communities
Intergenerational trauma and continued struggle for recognition
